intro: Dioscorea narinensis, commonly known as the Narin yam, is a species of tuberous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by cylindrical fruits containing numerous seeds. Its tubers are edible and have been traditionally used in local cuisines. The botanical features of D. narinensis make it an important species for both ecological and agricultural studies.
